response:
Ipsilateral lower cranial nerve IX/X/XII LMN signs (palate deviating right, tongue deviating left), ipsilateral Horner’s syndrome and limb hypotonia/ataxia, contralateral (right) spastic hemiparesis with hyperreflexia and extensor plantar, contralateral body sensory disturbance, gait ataxia and gaze-evoked nystagmus together indicate a single lesion in the left medulla involving cranial nerve nuclei/roots, descending sympathetics, inferior cerebellar connections and corticospinal/ascending sensory pathways above the pyramidal decussation.

lesion_locations = ["left hemimedulla"]
